ğŸ“– Vol 3: Disciplining the Soul
Know that every human is ignorant of his own faults, so if he strives against his Soul (Nafs) with the slightest striving until he abandons the gross sins, perhaps he thinks of himself that he has refined his Soul (Nafs) and improved his character and become independent of striving, so it is necessary to clarify the sign of good character. For good character is Faith (Iman), and bad character is Hypocrisy (Nifaq). And Allah the Exalted has mentioned the attributes of the believers and the hypocrites in His Book, and they are in their entirety the fruit of good character and bad character. So let us present a summary of that to know the sign of good character. Allah the Exalted said: "Indeed, the believers have succeeded (Qad aflaha al-mu'minuna) - those who are humble in their prayer and who turn away from idle talk" to His saying "Those are the inheritors." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers" to His saying "and give good tidings to the believers." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble" to His saying "Those are the true believers." And He the Exalted said: "And the servants of the Most Merciful who walk upon the earth easily and when the ignorant address them, they say peace" to the end of the surah. Whoever is confused about his condition, let him present himself to these verses, for the presence of all these attributes is a sign of good character, and the absence of all of them is a sign of bad character, and the presence of some without others indicates some without others, so let him occupy himself with acquiring what he lacks and preserving what he has found.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
And what indicates the virtue of this characteristic is the saying of Allah the Exalted: 'And those who give what they give while their hearts are fearful (Wajila) that they are to their Lord returning' (23:60), meaning that they give the acts of obedience while they are in great fear (Wajal) of their acceptance. And He the Exalted said: 'Indeed, those who are from fear (Khashya) of their Lord are apprehensive (Mushfiqun)' (23:57). And He the Exalted said: 'Indeed, we were before among our people apprehensive (Mushfiqun)' (52:26). And Allah the Exalted described the angels, peace be upon them, with their sanctity from sins and their persistence in acts of worship diligently, with apprehension (Ishfaq), as He the Exalted said informing about them: 'They drag the night and the day without ceasing, and they are from fear (Khashya) of Him apprehensive (Mushfiqun)' (21:20). So when the apprehension (Ishfaq) and caution from what has preceded in the decree in eternity (Al-Azal) - and is revealed at the end of the term (Al-Ajal) - is removed, security (Al-Amn) from the deception of Allah prevails, and that necessitates arrogance (Al-Kibr), which is the cause of destruction. So arrogance (Al-Kibr) is an indicator of security (Al-Amn), and security (Al-Amn) is destructive. And humility (Al-Tawadu') is an indicator of fear (Al-Khawf), and it is felicitous; therefore, what the worshipper corrupts by harboring arrogance (Al-Kibr) and despising the creation and looking at them with the eye of belittlement is more than what he rectifies with the apparent works. So these are knowledges (Ma'arif) by which the disease of arrogance (Al-Kibr) is removed from the heart (Al-Qalb) only, except that the soul (Al-Nafs) after this knowledge (Ma'rifa) may harbor humility (Al-Tawadu') and claim innocence from arrogance (Al-Kibr) while it is lying, so if it falls, it returns to its nature and forgets its promise, thus on this, it is not appropriate to suffice in the treatment with mere knowledge (Ma'rifa), but it should be completed with action (Al-'Amal) and tested with the actions of the humble in situations of the arousal of arrogance (Al-Kibr) in the soul (Al-Nafs).

a.g: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.
And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.
But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides disbelief which they are doing,
Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.
Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.
My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels
In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.
Then have they not reflected over the Qur'an, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?
Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?
Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.
Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.
And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]
Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.
And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.
They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."
Say, [O Muhammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"
They will say, "To Allah." Say, "Then will you not remember?"
Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"
They will say, "[They belong] to Allah." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"
They will say, "[All belongs] to Allah." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"
Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.

Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].

I seek refuge in Allah from the whisperings (hamazat) of the devils (shayatin), and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present.'
